title: Marlee Matlin
content: Marlee is an Academy Award winning actress, known for her leading role in Children of a Lesser God (1986). Deaf since the age of 18 months due to a genetically malformed cochlea, Matlin also received a Golden Globe Award for her role in Children of a Lesser God, and has since gone on to guest star in many high profile television series such as The L Word and Law & Order: SVU. She has also appeared on reality shows such as The Apprentice and Dancing with the Stars.

title: Ralph Braun
content: The late founder of the Braun Corporation one of the leading manufacturers of wheelchair accessible vehicles and named a champion of change by President Barack Obama, Ralph Braun was a man who thrived on bringing the freedom of mobility to people living with disabilities.

title: Stephen Hawking
content: Stephen Hawking was one of the most well-known physicists in the world, and was diagnosed with ALS when he was 21
